meanings.definition: Worn down or reduced in size or strength through constant use or friction.
meanings.sent1: The attrited rope snapped under the weight of the heavy load.
meanings.sent2: The attrited pencil was too small to use for writing.
meanings.sent3: The attrited shoes made squeaky noises with every step.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was attrited by the long wait in line.
meanings.sent5: The attrited wall crumbled under the pressure of the storm.

meanings.definition: To wear down or reduce in size or strength through constant use or friction.

meanings.sent3: The chef attrited the garlic cloves to release their flavor.
meanings.sent4: The old documents were attrited by years of handling.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive motion attrited the gears of the machine.
